txt.en: 'Greetings.'
'Does it truly matter?'
'After spending so much time in my care, I am surprised you have returned so quickly, Golodir.'
'Does it change all that has been lost in your futile attempts to shatter the Iron Crown?'
'Have you spent so little time in mourning your daughter?'
'Mother was lost... friends uncounted slain....'
'I can see that you have learned nothing from all my patient instruction.'
'And for what?'
'Those who opposed the Witch-king did so for many reasons.'
'Perhaps simply viewing others through the palantír was not enough.'
'Only for you to see your beloved daughter lying dead before the gates of Carn Dûm.'
'Some sought freedom from Angmar's yoke...'
'Come now, Golodir, let your lessons continue.'
'Give up in this vain pursuit, Father... it is folly to hold to your hope....'
'Others sought glory...'
'There is no shame in surrendering, when you have lost so very much....'
'And yet others sought revenge.'
'However, no matter what drove them, what flame burned in their hearts...'
'...that flame was extinguished.'

'Mordirith the coward has escaped us... but did you notice that the blade of Dúnachar was still lodged within his breast? I wager the pain of that blade's light shall be a constant reminder of the evil he has committed.

'While my revenge is not yet complete, I would wager there will be others who will complete this task. For now, I can take solace in this fact...

'A moment, someone approaches!'

'What an unsettling end to our battle. I fear that there is much more to that old woman than what we see upon the surface.\n\n'However, we cannot deal with that matter now. We should leave here before we are overrun with Angmarim or their servants!'
'We should tarry here no longer. Are you prepared to leave? I will show you the secret ways out of Carn Dûm and back to Gath Forthnír.'

'It seems my long imprisonment in Carn Dûm has served us well. We have come far into the the Witch-king's keep unnoticed. It would be folly to think, though, that our fortune will hold. Already, Mordirith may be aware of our presence.

'Steel yourself for the battle ahead. I have few words of advice to offer you, other than to warn you that Mordirith is a master of trickery and illusion. He will try to break your resolve with his words. Do not let him! Keep to your hope and trust your companions.

'Shall we go now?'
'Pay no heed to his words!'
'Oh, you have done well, young ones!'
'Where now are your words, False King?'
'Your questions will be answered in time!'
'So be it!'
'But for now, know that you have done me a great favour!'
'With the Light of Dúnachar, I strike thee down, False King!'
'A great favour indeed....'
'Base coward!'
'My friends, please help me... dispel this horrible illusion!'
'You are wrong, Mordirith!'
'The Light of Dúnachar, Avenger of the West, shall strike you down!'
Speak to Golodir
Aid Golodir
Aid Golodir
Talk to Golodir
Talk to Golodir
'Look! The gate to the east opens!'
'Enough!'
'Old woman, who are you? What are you doing here?'
'This... this is not possible....'
'She... she has taken the palantír!'
'It is gone and with no way to follow her!'
'I fear that we shall hear from that old woman again, and sooner than we would wish it!'
'Steel yourselves, as Mordirith will try many things to break our resolve.'
'Follow me, friends!'
'Those fallen! They are but Mordirith's illusions! Do not let them break your resolve!'
'We are nearly to Mordirith himself. Stand firm!'
Instance: Mordirith's Fall
'What... no! No! You are not her! You are another illusion!'
'Even I, dear Golodir, learned the folly of opposing the Witch-king.'
'A lesson I learned from his very hand...'
'As he \qinstructed\q me, all was torn away....'
'Thoughts of family...'
'...of brothers in arms...'
'...of friends and companions....'
'Once my lessons were complete, the man I had been... was gone.'
'Even I, one of the Witch-king's greatest foes, had become but his servant, a steward upon his throne.'
'So, Golodir, if you still hold to your fool's hope, come forward....'
'You see, Golodir, over the long years of this age, many have tried to resist Angmar...'
'All have failed.'
'Do you wish to join these countless failures in death?'
'You shall not carry this day!'
'Golodir, do not forget what you have lost!'
'Angmar shall never fall!'
'You cannot win this day!'
'Steel yourself. We are entering the very heart of Angmar....'
'The Witch-king built this, his throne room, to celebrate his terrible might and power.'
'And now Mordirith sits upon his throne as Steward of the Witch-king's realm.'
'Where is he...?'
'Mordirith! Show yourself!'
You have travelled deep into Carn Dûm with Golodir, into the very fortress of the Witch-king himself. Here Golodir hopes to confront Mordirith and shatter the Iron Crown forever.
'Enough of your illusions and \qlessons!\q
'Villain! I would have died in her place!'
'And it would have been better for you if I had!'
'False King? I am more justly a king than he who sits before my throne.'
'Let us be done, Golodir. In the end... your \qvictory\q here matters not!'
'No!'
Aid Golodir as you make your way deeper into the Castle of the Witch-king.
'I have... but one last... reserve of strength, Golodir....'
With the light of Dúnachar, Golodir has defeated Mordirith, although the villain escaped before he could be completely defeated. You should speak with Golodir to see what he would wish you to do.
'You have... done well... but the light of your blade was not enough....'
A voice resounds off the walls, \qBut Golodir, there is one last lesson I have to teach you....\q
You should speak with Golodir at once.
'I leave you now... perhaps, Golodir, we... will meet again....'
'Well Golodir, it seems nothing will make you see the truth of my words.'
'And if my words cannot convince you of the folly of challenging Angmar...'
'Falling in battle before me will!'
'But Father, there is one last lesson to be taught....'
'You see, Golodir! I cannot be harmed!'
'Am I? Am I really, Father?'
